item.title: Shop handler, Delta, not CFG
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

public int[] skillCapes = {9747,9753,9750,9768,9756,9759,9762,9801,9807,9783,9798,9804,9780,9795,9792,9774,9771,9777,9786,9810,9765}; public int get99Count() { int count = 0; for (int j = 0; j < c.playerLevel.length; j++) { if (c.getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[j]) >= 99) { count++; } } return count; }

item.title: Shop handler, Delta, not CFG
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

You probably have a different file something like ShopAssistant which handles buying and selling items. Create an array list in there and a void that handles if you have the skill level required by checking through char files.

public void skillCapes() { int capes = checkSkillLevel(); if (SkillLevel > 99) capes = 1; else capes = 0; c.ShopId = ##; }
